Both movies are very different from Titanic in terms of genre, so I hope one or both pique your interest!

I'd highly recommend "Lincoln" for you! This film is a gripping portrayal of President Abraham Lincoln's struggle during the Civil War, particularly his fight to end slavery. Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Hal Holbrook give noteworthy performances in this historical drama. If you're interested in tales about conflict and power struggles, I believe you'll find it engaging.

Alternatively, "American Gangster" could also be a great fit. This biographical crime film follows the life of Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, played by Denzel Washington. It showcases an intense story of ambition and the underground world of organized crime in the 1970s.

I'd highly recommend "Amen." for you! This gripping film stars Ulrich Mühe and Sebastian Koch, and it's a captivating tale about a SS officer trying to inform Pope Pius XII about Jews being sent to extermination camps during World War II. It's based on true events and is a powerful watch.

Alternatively, if you enjoy action-packed thrillers, you might also enjoy "Proof of Life" starring Russell Crowe. In this film, he plays an engineer who gets kidnapped in South America, and his wife hires a professional negotiator to secure his release. It's filled with suspense and intrigue!

conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "American Sniper" for you. This powerful film tells the true story of Navy SEAL Chris Kyle, portrayed by Bradley Cooper, and his experiences as a sniper during four tours in Iraq. It's an intense and moving portrayal of war and its impact on those who fight it. Another great choice is "The Alamo" (2004), which recounts the legendary 1836 standoff between Texan and Tejano forces and Mexican dictator Santa Anna's troops. It stars Dennis Quaid and offers a gripping portrayal of heroism in the face of overwhelming odds. Enjoy!
